div.p: In the unit state Battery operation the system will be in battery operation.
The system will switch over to battery operation if the rectifier mains becomes unavailable for any reason. The switch over to battery operation is automatic without interruption.

In battery operation the batteries are being discharged to supply the load. The battery voltage drops as a function of the duration and the battery output current. The AC output voltage is kept constant by the inverter. An alarm will activate when the batteries are almost discharged. If the mains returns (by any means and is within the tolerance range) the system will automatically switch back to normal operation.

If the mains does not return before the batteries are discharged, the system will automatically change to bypass operation (if the bypass mains is available and within the tolerance range) to prevent deep discharge of the batteries.
If the batteries have been discharged and both the rectifier mains and bypass mains are unavailable, the system will turn off.
